result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. Gross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.   Counseling shall specifically include:  Sex offender treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $ TBD    plus surcharges.
*   State shall have 60 days to determine.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with AMM or her family or her residence or any children under age 18, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Register as a sex offender, comply w/ requirements of registry.  No pornography, no use of intermet/computer w/o approval of the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim compliance.  Court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP; 2 years initial confinement w/credit for 337 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied from 13CM1326 to costs.
Amended Info

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Barth acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 7/16/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Barth states a new offer was received that the deft wants time to consider.  STC continued to 6/9/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Barth the STC of 6/4/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled to 6/5/15 at 10am, as he did not have it on his calendar for 6/4/15 and has a conflict w/a Racine case.
Bail/bond hearing on June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No record made.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared in custody.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Michael Barth is in trial in another court and unavailable for today's hearing.  BBH reset for 6/4/15 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

ADA Delgado states she will be filing a motion to forfeit bond.  BBH set for 5/11/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
With ADA Delgado and Atty Edwards the time of the STC on 3/30/15 is changed from 9am to 8:15am.

With ADA Delgado and Atty Edwards, and by approval of the court, the JS of 3/30/15 at 9am is changed to a STC and the JS is rescheduled to 7/13/15 at 9am, as the State has not received the DNA analysis, two of State's witnesses are unavailable and Atty Edwards has a #1 trial in another branch.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards motion to modify bond continued.  Court amends bond to a $50,000 signature bond, deft may reside at 8743 Sheridan Rd, he is to have no women or children present in that residence; no contact w/victims or victims family, no contact with any children under 18years old, if he moves he is to notify the court w/n 48 hrs.  Case remains set for trial.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Delgado requests adjournment of trial; states that the DNA sample was sent to the crime lab and results are not back yet; also the disclosure witness is unavailable to appear this week and the victim failed to appear at DA's office, requests material witness warrant.  Atty Edwards objects to adjournment of trial.  Court grants motion to adjourn trial.  Court issues a material witness warrant for victim to be held in West Bend (Washington County) til trial, but can be brought to court prior to being taken to West Bend.  Atty Edwards moves to modify bond.  Court adjourns bond hearing to 1/30/15 at 9am; JS reset to 3/30/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.
